data.title: Sierpinski Triangles
data.statement:
Sierpinski triangles are geometric recursive constructions. Given a Sierpinski triangle, construction of the next Sierpinski triangle in the sequence involves the following steps.

<<Step 0:>> Original Sierpinski triangle; [[N]] = 1.

` /\
/__\`
<<Step 1:>> Duplicate the triangle to the right.

` /\  /\
/__\/__\`
<<Step 2:>> Duplicate the original triangle above the current construction.

` /\
/__\
 /\  /\
/__\/__\`
<<Step 3:>> Align the top triangle to the centre of the bottom row; [[N]] = 2.

`   /\
  /__\
 /\  /\
/__\/__\`

<<Constructing [[N]] = 3 Sierpinski triangle:>> Repeat steps 1-3.

`       /\
      /__\
     /\  /\
    /__\/__\
   /\      /\
  /__\    /__\
 /\  /\  /\  /\
/__\/__\/__\/__\`

The first Sierpinski triangle ([[N]] = 1) is provided for you as [[K]] rows of strings that are each of length [[2K]]. (Note that <<the triangle will differ>> from test to test!) Can you draw the [[N]]-th Sierpinski triangle?

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Sierpinski triangles are geometric recursive constructions. Given a Sierpinski triangle, construction of the next Sierpinski triangle in the sequence involves the following steps.

Step 0: Original Sierpinski triangle; N = 1.

 /\
/__\

Step 1: Duplicate the triangle to the right.

 /\  /\
/__\/__\

Step 2: Duplicate the original triangle above the current construction.

 /\
/__\
 /\  /\
/__\/__\

Step 3: Align the top triangle to the centre of the bottom row; N = 2.

   /\
  /__\
 /\  /\
/__\/__\


Constructing N = 3 Sierpinski triangle: Repeat steps 1-3.

       /\
      /__\
     /\  /\
    /__\/__\
   /\      /\
  /__\    /__\
 /\  /\  /\  /\
/__\/__\/__\/__\


The first Sierpinski triangle (N = 1) is provided for you as K rows of strings that are each of length 2K. (Note that the triangle will differ from test to test!) Can you draw the N-th Sierpinski triangle?
Input
Line 1: A single positive integer N.
Line 2: A single positive integer K.
Next K lines: A string of length exactly 2K. Collectively, they denote the N = 1 Sierpinski triangle.
Output
The N-th Sierpinski triangle.
Each line of output should not contain any trailing spaces.
(hint: you should only trim trailing spaces for the final Sierpinski triangle)
Constraints
1 ≤ N ≤ 5
1 ≤ K ≤ 3
Example
Input
2
2
 /\ 
/__\
Output
   /\
  /__\
 /\  /\
/__\/__\
